intro: Malanea forsteronioides, commonly known as the Forster's malanea, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of red and orange. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
